oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.globalSearch.ui.searchSuggest
Class DefaultGroupSuggestGroup

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.patterns.ui.behaviors.searchSuggest.AbstractSearchSuggestGroup
      oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.globalSearch.ui.searchSuggest.DefaultGroupSuggestGroup
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, SearchSuggestGroup
public class DefaultGroupSuggestGroup
extends AbstractSearchSuggestGroup

A suggest group for helo filling in the group expression field. It will suggest the defined groups, and hint to the user they can use an EL expression or a classname.

Since:
11.1.1.7.4
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getItems

public java.util.List<SearchSuggestItem> getItems(java.lang.String searchText,
                                                  int maxSuggestedItems)
Get the list of items, in the order shown in the auto suggest group. There should be no HTML markup in the individual items, bolding etc will be done by the framework. This list should be relatively concise, and may be trimmed by the framework if it is too long.

Note that there should be no assumption made that init() has been run to completion (it may be running in a background thread when this method is called, dependent on the return value of canBackgroundInit()), an empty list should be returned if no data is present.

This method is called inline with user key-presses, it MUST run quickly (< 10 msecs) and will be timed by the framework.

Parameters:
searchText - the text currently in the search field. The developer should filter on this value to provide a concise list of suggest items.
maxSuggestedItems - maximum number of suggested items to return. More can be returned but they will not be used whoever it is strongly recommended no more than this number is returned, and implementations use this number to exit the method at the first opportunity for efficienct.
Returns:
List of items so show, possibly empty but never null.

getTopSuggestions

public java.util.List<SearchSuggestItem> getTopSuggestions(java.lang.String searchText,
                                                           int maxSuggestedItems)
Get the list of top selection items.

These items are shown to the user in the search field when the user first clicks in the field, and are only shown for fnd:searchSelectBehaviors of type='popup' and topSuggestions='on'.

It is likely these items will not reflect any relation to 'searchText' which may be null, but show a simple starting list. Once the user starts to type, normal rules of getItems() will apply.

There should be no HTML markup in the individual items, bolding etc will be done by the framework. Note that there should be no assumption made that init() has been run to completion (it may be running in a background thread when this method is called, dependent on the return value of canBackgroundInit()), an empty list should be returned if no data is present.

This method is called when the user first enters the field, it MUST run quickly (< 10 msecs) and will be timed by the framework. The default implementation does nothing. Implementors should over-ride this method for their purposes.

Specified by:
getTopSuggestions in interface SearchSuggestGroup
Overrides:
getTopSuggestions in class AbstractSearchSuggestGroup
Parameters:
searchText - text in the search field, may be null and may be ignored.
maxSuggestedItems - maximum number of suggested items to return. More can be returned but they will not be used whoever it is strongly recommended no more than this number is returned, and implementations use this number to exit the method at the first opportunity for efficienct.
Returns:
List of items so show, possibly empty but never null.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Get the code name for the group. Non-translatable and should be short and unique across groups. It should conform to regular java variable identifiers (no exotic characters) so it can be serialized across the network.

Specified by:
getName in interface SearchSuggestGroup
Overrides:
getName in class AbstractSearchSuggestGroup
Returns:
code name.

getGroupHeading

public SearchSuggestGroup.GroupHeading getGroupHeading()
Whether we show the heading for this group. Valid values are "on" or "off", the default is "on".

Overrides:
getGroupHeading in class AbstractSearchSuggestGroup
Returns:
"on" or "off".
See Also:
AbstractSearchSuggestGroup.getDisplayName(), AbstractSearchSuggestGroup.setDisplayName(java.lang.String)

canRunInCurrentEnvironment

public boolean canRunInCurrentEnvironment()
Can this group run in the current environment? This method will be called before the init method, if a group returns false from this method it will be excluded from the in-memory list of groups and init(), getItems() etc never called. By Default this method returns true.

Overrides:
canRunInCurrentEnvironment in class AbstractSearchSuggestGroup
Returns:
true if the group can run in the current environment, for example a Classic UIShell page, or a FUSE page.
See Also:
AbstractSearchSuggestGroup.init(java.util.Map)

placeSelectedItemInField

public boolean placeSelectedItemInField()
Is the selected item placed in the search field when selected? The default implementation returns true if !requiresSubmit(), false otherwise. Implementors should over-ride for different functionality.

Overrides:
placeSelectedItemInField in class AbstractSearchSuggestGroup

canBackgroundInit

public boolean canBackgroundInit(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attributes)
By default, groups are background init'ed unless there are top suggestions, in which case initialization is required immediately.

Specified by:
canBackgroundInit in interface SearchSuggestGroup
Overrides:
canBackgroundInit in class AbstractSearchSuggestGroup
Parameters:
attributes - the attributes from fnd:searchSuggestBehavior.
Returns:
true unless topSuggestions is set.
See Also:
SearchSuggestGroup.init(java.util.Map)
